title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Easy peasy - just got asked a few questions about why I wanted to be here, and then I chatted with the interviewer who was very nice. I felt like it was more of a conversation than an interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you like Charlottesville / what brings you here?

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial Zoom call with the hiring manager, a social media assignment, a call with a panel of stakeholders, and then an additional conversation before a decision was made between the finalists. The process took about two months from applying to the final decision. UVA and the Cooper Center were very responsive and stuck to timelines with letting candidates know their status. All of the interviews were virtual and took about 30 minutes each with time allowed for questions.
Interview Questions: How can you break down complex information on social media for our audience to understand?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening first, and then in-person interview. Screening was on video with two people, and the interview was in person with two people. It was easygoing. This was all with the hiring department. However, dealing with UVA HR itself is horrific.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, why do you want to be a lab tech, what experience do you have in a lab, etc.

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: 1 Round of Interviews with a panel (5 people) . Each of the panel members introduces themselves, and later the candidate is asked to do the same. Usually, they expect slides from candidates to explain their work, etc.
Interview Questions: What is the reason behind your area of interest?

title: Web Developer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: They asked me questions mainly about my resume. They also asked me a few questions about the languages the job would be using and my commitment to it. Overall, it was very relaxed and not too hard.
Interview Questions: How committed would you be to this opportunity if you got it?

title: Full Stack Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I went through two zoom interviews going over projects I had done and navigating a bug fix on their website. I was told there would be a third interview and then got ghosted. Three weeks later after multiple contact attempts I got a message saying he was hesitant to remove me from consideration but there are other people they are interviewing instead. That didn't make much sense and was extremely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What projects have I worked on in the past?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: I had a phenomenal time interviewing and preparing for the role.. Very accommodating benefits and payment. Would recommend to any students. Make sure to remain in contact with professor throughout process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the role?

title: Project Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA)
Interview Descriptions: mostly behavioral in nature and really was about trying to understand how you can contribute to the project. A large aspect was trying to see if your values align with the values of the foundation.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself relevant experience

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview it is important to have a relationship with the teacher and get good grades to be a TA for the University of Virginia. It is possible that graduate TAs have interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your availability to teach?

title: MTA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview process, just talked to a professor about TAing for them and they accepted. I work on grading exams, homework and projects, and hold some office hours.
Interview Questions: How much time can you commit per week to this class?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Applied through common app and got accepted after three rounds of interviews including behaviorals and academic tests (math exam, essay writing, etc.). It also including activities  like a debate competition.
Interview Questions: General behaviorals and questions around academic interests

title: Postdoc Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: The greatest experience I ever had. There were general questions with a very friendly discussion of my previous scientific/ research work in the lab.  The interview took around one hour.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed up by in person panel. Mostly focused on how previous work experience could translate into this role. It was very conversational and professional yet not too formal.
Interview Questions: How do you manage competing priorities?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Their interview process consisted of two interactions. The first was via phone call with a few people on the line, the next was via Zoom with a few people. The people were very nice, easy and efficient.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experience.

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: you have to apply with your resume, transcrpit, cover letter and recommendations. Then you must go in for an interview. I never even heard back from the intervirw so i was upset. youre making me do this and ive never even worked for a company. this is so stupid.
Interview Questions: what is your expierence in the field

title: Athletics Ticket Sales & Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Participated in two phone interviews, one with a hiring staff and the other with a manager. Both were friendly and courteous. The questions asked were reasonable for the scope of the job and they answered all of my questions to my satisfaction.
Interview Questions: What are your future career plans?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Detailed explanation of position and requirements for RA who will be fulfilling the position. Discussion of resume and past relevant experience. Asked standard interview questions. Discussed work hours, working conditions, and hourly rate.
Interview Questions: What would you say is your greatest strength?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Met with Principal Investigator and discussed the position in detail. The Principal Investigator explained the process for the coding that was required of the Research Assistant. The Principal Investigator also explained that the person who fills the position will be required to partner with other members in the lab.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with statistics and research methods?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Was not told that it would involve unpaid on-call hours. This was not disclosed by the hiring manager and felt very deceptive. I declined after hearing from an employee that this was the situation.
Interview Questions: Q: How did you handle competing priorities?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: A series of questions about mostly teaching philosophy, and diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives I’ve taken. They were polite and asked follow up questions. Salary not great for ntt positions.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Software Developer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the UVA Internship Placement Program Coordinator. Behavioral interview with questions about IPP and the reason for it. Also asked about general questions about the reason for the ranking.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose UVA Dev Hub?

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: The interview was relaxed and you didn't feel stressed. Proper questions were asked, and it was a good environment that was stress free.  I positively enjoyed my experience.  I think that it was done properly and it was good experience.
Interview Questions: How would you make the center a better place?

title: Clinical Research Administration Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Simple process, working directly with the hiring manager. had 1st initial call with just the hiring manager and a second call with the team that the position would be leading to discuss current processes and potential improvements.
Interview Questions: General discussion questions based on the specialty of the role were asked.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: It was super easy. I was a student, so no experience was required. I just called Prof Williams on the phone and talked about what I was supposed to do.
Interview Questions: What would you like to do?

title: Media Team Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Very rigorous interview with questions, interview performance feedback and a project of your choosing that was ultimately a good professional development experience. First time I've interviewed and gotten responses on my answers.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: The interview was thorough, fair, and engaging. I was asked to provide my professional background and they were very clear about the roles and responsibilities of the position. Overall, I would say that the interview was instructive.
Interview Questions: Tell me why this role in particular is of interest

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed three times over a 2.5 month period. Three months after the first interview I received an official offer. The first interview was virtual and the second two were in person. They asked for five references after completing the third interview. References were required to complete a short survey with two open ended questions.
Interview Questions: Asked about my master's degree thesis, relevant experience, current position etc.

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Disjointed interview process. Appreciated hiring manager providing some feedback, but didn't appreciate the content. One interviewer had a clear conflict of interest and didn't disclose this and proceeded with interviewing.
Interview Questions: Asked about how I would handle political questions and ultimately did not hire me because of my "activism".

title: UVA Athletic Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my resume, then I came in and talked to the supervisor and he asked me questions about myself and then he told me what my responsibilities would be
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past work experiences

title: Tech Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: It was a good experience and I enjoyed meeting the team. I would recommend applying and hearing what the company offers even with the pandemic in affect. This is worth the time and effort to get there!
Interview Questions: What brought you to this company?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottsville, PA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview for the intern role. Taking just a short of 30 minutes, the interview was quick and friendly. The phone interview was the only interview in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: - Tell me about yourself

title: Presidential Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
3 rounds: (1) first on zoom (2) in person with several interviewers from the presidents office (3) final interview and a follow up

It was a friendly experience but I wish I had been given feedback. Hiring timeline longer than originally stated, but that's normal in academia
Interview Questions: Experience, priorities in the role, handle conflict, communication

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was mostly behavioral questions. The Unit manager/Asst manager will interview you. In some cases some senior staff will conduct a peer interview as well. It was overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to our facility?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Data Science for the Public Good Summer program as an undergraduate intern. I had only one round of a behavioral interview with two supervisors Research Associate Professors.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why I want to work with them. Tell me about your research ...(listed on my CV)

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Two panel interviews. The first was with other research staff and the second was with professors and research directors. Typical behavioral and fit questions. Seemed very focused on ability to manage up.
Interview Questions: Describe your preferred working style. If you are leading a project, how do you manage those how do not directly work for you?

title: Case Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Discussed the position with project manager and sponsoring professors. Light conversation about experience and qualifications for role. Long process, however that spanned a few months. Overall, very positive experience and I greatly enjoyed the conversations with all involved.
Interview Questions: How does your experience prepare you for this role?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fine seemed pretty easy, not a good work environment, careful of your PI, you can fall off track sometimes, asked standard questions and was not too difficult to answer, questionaire as well
Interview Questions: Complete a questionnaire, but not a good work environment

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: This interview was for the ITS department. I had an initial phone call which was followed by an in-person interview. It was a general conversation where they explained what they did, asked about my background, and asked behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Can you go into more details with regards to your work experience?

title: University Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: It was an application online, which included various essays and submissions of transcript and test scores. There was multiple options of essays to choose from. Ask counselors to submit the transcript.
Interview Questions: What would you add to the Beta Bridge?

title: Senior Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call from the hiring manager.  Then, I had a zoom meeting with the hiring team. the call lasted about fifty minutes. The interviewers were very polite.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Campaign Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed once in person for about 30 minutes with 2 interviewers and then contacted with an offer in a timely manner. After getting hired, I was also given feedback on my performance in the interview for my own professional development.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: A group presentation was required and had many one on one interviews with behavioral questions. Asked many fit questions and why I wanted to pursue the role. Also, asked regarding student service orientation and the ability to work well with other colleagues.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself from childhood up to now.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Fair and straightforward interview process. Good overview of job opportunities and discussion of job description. The Human Resources Department was very helpful in recruitment process and outlining benefits associated with the position.
Interview Questions: Past job experience and area of work

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and collaborative. Multiple opportunities to ask questions, meet potential team mates and understand the role. A very smart and enthusiastic group of people that are looking for a good cultural fit with new hires.
Interview Questions: How I aligned with the culture

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process went well. The hiring manager was very polite. The hiring manager and I met and there was a few questions and an explanation of the process. I was introduced to some of the responsibilities and asked about how I would handle certain situations and what sort of ideas I had to answer some types of issues.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Learning And Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Phone and in person interview  were conducted. Consisted of behavioral questions and more situational response questions in related to the role. It was a straight forward process, applied online and received an email.
Interview Questions: How would you respond if a student was upset that they still had to receive mentoring and expressed this during the session

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth.  I came into their office and she asked me the standard questions and told me about the unit and I was able to ask her any questions that I had.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background, why I wanted the job, to describe a difficult time

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Did a skype interview and was asked to complete a quiz afterward. Felt as if the interviewer was arguing with me while I answered the questions, I was speaking of my experience...
Interview Questions: Do you like working alone?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 1 on 1 with the professor asking about my prior experience and interest with focus on computer science skill. I had preciously taken cs couse so jt was very easy to answer.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with python

title: Saturday Enrichment Program Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia (University, VA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process went very smoothly because all of the members of the SEP are kind and knowledgeable. There was one general application and then the interview process. It took around 15 minutes. They asked about prior teaching/tutoring experience and whether I have any specific skills in any of the classes they offer.
Interview Questions: What prior teaching or volunteering experience have you had?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to the professor and they asked to have a quick conversation about my projects / experience. They asked me simple questions about my interest within the industry and which programming languages I knew. Very simple process, but I know it differs between each department.
Interview Questions: Q: What projects have you worked on in the past?

title: Advanvement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (New York, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and didn't hear back until a few weeks later.  First was a simple screening call over the phone with the recruiter. Next week, a second call with someone in the department who held a similar position. This was more in depth and had standard interview questions.  Around a week and a half later I had an on grounds set of interviews (2 panels, 2 one-on-ones) that lasted 3 hours. The next week I had a video conference interview with 2 directors that hasn't been present the other day. The very next day I was told they would be charging references. The next week I got an offer. Though the initial screening process can be slow, it felt thorough and made me feel the University makes the effort to achieve the best possible fit between candidate and position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position/in UVA

title: Mailroom Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and applicable to student workers. Felt very comfortable during the interview and I was asked reasonable questions. Great for students eligible for work study! On boarding was not difficult, definitely recommend going to the Career Center!
Interview Questions: What was your favorite quality about a previous employer?

title: Audio/Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick and easy. It took me about 3 weeks to apply, interview,  be hired, and get started. I was referred by a friend, so it made my life easier. Because of this, I was able to have an interview scheduled within two days of applying
Interview Questions: How well do you work under pressure?

title: Commun Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed with a team of people and my potential supervisor. Then another team came in, and I interviewed with them. Then my potential supervisor took me to meet the dean of the school. 
A few days later they gave me homework, consisting of five different assignments, all specific to the job.
A week later they said they would let me know in a week.
A week later they said I was not qualified for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you work on several projects at the same time?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
2-day on-site interview after initial skype meetins with Lab Manager and PI. Was comped for gas and hotel.

Worked alongside Lab Manager for those 2 days and got a feel for the lab.
Interview Questions: No particular questions, it was a working interview, not a traditional table interview.

title: Lab Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Around 1 week after submitting the online application, I received an email from the lab to arrange for a phone interview. The interview lasted around 30 minutes, and I spoke with both the PI and another lab member.
Interview Questions: Talk about your personal experience in population science. What is your understanding of population science?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief process. First met with one professor to discuss my interests and the project. Then was referred to and met with one of the cardiologists on the project. Finally met with both cardiologists together.
Interview Questions: Generally asked about my interests and specifically my interests in the project. Asked about how my skills would apply.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted through skype by the PI. Very informal. Will ask about previous lab experience and why you want to work in the lab.  Make sure to go over techniques that are listed and known how to perform them.
Interview Questions: Why interested in working in VA?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Sit down behavioral interview. No real issues, just gaging your interest and why you want the job. Overall enjoyable experience. Great opportunity for a student trying to work and study at the same time.
Interview Questions: Why this job?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Discussed position roles with lead professor.  Talked with other candidates about what they were excited about, nervous about, questioned about the coming semester. Approached potential problems and my role in the teaching process.
Interview Questions: What are you nervous about teaching this semester?

title: Research program advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was as expected - somewhat challenging, but I prepared well. The supervisor asked relevant questions and allowed me to ask questions about the team as well. The interview was about 30 minutes long. I had two interviews - one with the immediate supervisor and the second interview with a higher up team member.
Interview Questions: How I have handled difficult co-worker situations in the past. How I am able to multi-task.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed 3 rounds plus an oral presentation. The subject of the presentation is assigned. I sort of feel this is the most rigorous screening procedure that a candidate could go through, even though I know these guys very well.
Interview Questions: The most simple one: what's your plan for your near-term career?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy process with long intervals between the various phone and in-person interviews. But the overall experience was pleasant and all parties professional and cordial. The interviewers were genuinely open to answering any questions I had about working at UVA, and specifically about the department and position itself.  I would have accepted the position had it been offered.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance in managing a project where things went wrong and what did you do to correct it?

title: Alderman Circulation Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview after resume review. I was called by the manager and asked many questions regarding time minimum and commitment level. I was also asked about experience that I had and what else I was involved with at school. Interview was about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work her?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: Generally a positive working environment, but much more is expected of GTA's than in other departments. Prepare to work day and night to complete duties. On top of research and student duties, GTAs are expected to take on almost a full teaching load, including grading, which is very strenuous for a graduate student.
Interview Questions: What teaching experience do you have?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: - Applied for the job online but also had an inside connection that I emailed my resume to, they called a couple of weeks later to set up an in-person interview,  at the in-person interview they asked some questions,  took a total of maybe 20 minutes including formalities, was told if you are hired within a week
Interview Questions: Do you have customer service experience and how can that help you in this job? What is an important aspect of working at Newcomb?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions:
This is based on 5 interviews with UVA. Here is a summation of my overall experience: 1. HR and interview committees are set up like it's the 1990's and not 2018  2. I was asked many "canned" questions and really no excitement/interest from anyone on the committees  3. half the positions provided zero follow-ups after the first round of interviews  4. Interview committees seem to value "tradition" or "status quo" vs. progressive ideas or creative thinking  5. never received reimbursement following an on-campus interview even when I submitted receipts

UVA may be reputable but in terms of the hiring process they are fairly backward and mired in their own arrogance. I'm never again applying for positions at UVA or recommending anyone I know go to school there. If my kids want to go to a large, public university in Virginia, it's VA Tech.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, And was followed up with to schedule a phone screen first by hiring manager as I was applying from out of state. In person interview followed, very flexible in scheduling
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult personalities

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Three people interviewed in a video conference. They described the work that is done in the laboratory, asked for previous research experience and the types of experiments or techniques previously used. They inquired about team skills majorly.
Interview Questions: Previous Research experience

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Simple online application, emailed a few days later to speak with manager about logistics and responsibilities. Performed swim test at interview and hired if you pass that. Overall the in person part lasted less than an hour.
Interview Questions: Have you been a lifeguard before

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process at all. Took the class during the fall of 2018. Really enjoyed the class and followed up with her around the end of the semester about the chance of being a TA the following semester. She wrote my name down and said she would keep my name in mind. Heard the following January that I had been selected as a Teaching Assistant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: It was a practical interview that took place in the pool. It basically encompassed all of the Red Cross Lifeguard skills that you learn in the certification course. Very low stress, and you do it with another guard
Interview Questions: How many hours per week can you work

title: Event Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: First they went over resume, questions about availability and hours I was able to work which was the most important part in the interview to be prepared for, friendly, laid-back, and nice.
Interview Questions: When are you available and how many hours per week would you be willing to work?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA)
Interview Descriptions: It was very detailed there were many questions about my work skills and how I handle different situations. The interviewer seemed very interested in me as a person and what my career goals are
Interview Questions: They asked about my skills

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. I applied online when I received an email from my professor about the job, and answered a few questions in written form about general past experiences and abilities.
Interview Questions: What past experience will assist in your success as a TA?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: There is no formal job interview involved, only graduate admissions documents to submit. That said, international students may be assessed on their level of English. For those whose level is not considered sufficient, they are asked to complete mandatory ESL courses upon enrollment.
Interview Questions: Graduate students are asked about their research interests at the time of interview, not teaching experience.

title: Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Virginia
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with two interviewers for a position in an extracurricular educational program. One was an administrator who oversaw the operations and logistics of the program, and the other was the head instructor of the program. Both alternated in asking questions about my background, my teaching style, my preferences in subjects, and the reason why I wanted to work there. They weren't condescending or invasive. In fact, they took each of my responses with a moment of rumination and a natural follow-up question - basically showed interest in me as a person, a teacher, and a professional rather than me as another cog in their machine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach?

title: Multimedia Contributor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Aug 2017

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The hardest part of getting hired at UVA is getting past the application process to get an interview. They are the largest employer citywide and everyone wants to work there. I actually got my foot in the door by speaking with a recruiter at a job fair and applying for jobs with UVATemps. UVA has its own Temp division. I dressed professionally for the job fair and treated it as an interview. 
I got a call back a few weeks later about the job. HR had to verify my past employment and spoke with all of my references. I went  to the HR office and filled out paperwork and spoke with a different HR rep about the position. I was then able to interview with the hiring manager. 
The interview with the hiring manager was really brief and consisted primarily of her telling me about the position. The job is in the Health System (UVA has a teaching hospital) and I believe she was quite busy and just wanted to make sure I was a dependable intelligent person before signing off on the hiring. This is for a four month position- not a permanent one. I answered a few questions about how my past work experience provided me the skill to complete the job and that was about it. I can't remember if we walked through the office and met people that day or not. 
I got a call later that they wanted me to start right away so I did.
Interview Questions: It was more of her describing the work to me, and my saying "Oh, that's like XYZ that I did at my old job" than asking questions.

title: Zone Maintenance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, in person panel interview. Job description was not the same at the interview as only about 2 paragraphs were available to outside of the CAMPUS (not grounds) applicants. That was an unfair hiring practice as I'm quite sure 'the inside' people got that information previously. There was no reason to make people wait seven weeks for information about being hired. I had two other job opportunities that I put on hold while waiting to never hear back. Extremely poor communication which I' sure is why they are creating this particular position.  I only found out that I wasn't hired because I wrote/emailed the HR staff directly which magically got the hiring person to send an email within hours...go figure. As many have stated the pay scale is absolutely awful, but I was willing to give-up a massive amount just for the luxury of working for UVA. Not now, it's totally not worth it. The facilities management department is a 'good-old-boys' club that you need to know someone to get your foot in the door.
Interview Questions: One of the pressure cooker (meant with sarcasm) questions they came up with was: "how do you know when a job is complete?"

title: Medical Office Coordinator - OB/GYN Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Got an email two days later after I sent my resume to come in for interview. She sent me a job description via email and I interviewed the following week. 

She did not tell me it would be a panel interview with a hr rep, my would be supervisor, and one of the medical office coordinators. They didn't even know who should ask which question nor did they know if any of the doctors would come in for the interview, yet they are supposed to manage their schedules. A hot mess. I think I dodged a bullet working for this department.

I followed up with them for a status update and was told I wasn't selected. I got an offer somewhere else anyway. 

They said they ask these interview questions to each candidate but they were reading from their interview paper hard core. They were also taking lots of notes. Two out of three of them weren't properly dressed for an interview. One wearing a t-shirt and another one wearing a t-shirt and maxi skirt. The one wearing the t-shirt gave me eye contact that was really intense each time I answered a question and it scared me a little bit. 

The interviewers need to know how to interview properly. What a waste of time going to this interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

Because of technical qualifications required of my position, he asked me many questions to be sure that I was a competent researcher and that I would be comfortable managing other tasks such as budgeting, managing research staff, and maintaining lab supplies.

Less than a week after the interview, I received a call with a offer to the position and I accepted. Interview Questions: why this job, future plans, what are strengths, any questions

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: They called me over the phone. We talked for about 45 minutes. Chatted casually about my past experience and why i wanted to go to graduate school. Also, they asked me to describe my future project and talk about it's relevance. It was all very casual and friendly. They said they would let me know in two weeks by email of their decision.
Interview Questions: Describe what you would want to work on?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Gave a department seminar, toured labs and had a one hour discussion with potential principal investigator. Toured the University of Virginia. Discussed benefits package. Met other members of the department.
Interview Questions: About my skill set

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Sent and email requesting a informational interview and site visit. Underwent multiple individual meetings with faculty and administrative staff throughout the department.  Gave a research presentation to the lab I was applying to.
Interview Questions: What are you scientific ambitions?

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Called in for individual and group interview, then did not hear for three months, at which point I was told I had been accepted. The salary was presented as nonnegotiable. As times were tough, I had no choice but to accept.
Interview Questions: How would you handle unreasonable requests from clients?

title: Shift Commander Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Takes a bit longer than most. I was interviewed within a month of applying. Background and process took 5 months. I attended a board and then individual interview.
Interview Questions: They asked pat standard law enforcement questions based on experience and knowledge. Nothing unexpected

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: After my M.S. in a neighboring department, I sent out a mass email with a proposed project I would like to work on in a different department. Received a response from 2 of the faculty. Walked over and talked to one of the faculty, was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: How will I transition from one project to the other completely unrelated research topic.

title: Pharmacy Technician Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview process is very friendly, positive, understandable, professional demeanor through verbal and non-verbal communications. The hospital set is organizational mission and values of respect,integrity, stewardship and excellence are evident in interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your goal if been hired?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Met current research faculty, flew out to visit. Discussed current and former research and applied to the overall program. Upon arrival for the center visit was told I was accepted. I had a relationship with one of the faculty and was hired through him. Because I knew my advisor he was able to help lobby for increased pay.
Interview Questions: Wasn't a classic interview process, as a research center and because I knew my advisor already I didn't have a true interview.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Virginia in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Lots of expectations from interviewers and lots of interviews for one position. Hiring process is very slow. I've had more than one job that I would swear had little if anything to do with the job as described in the posting.
Interview Questions: Describe a crisis at work and how you handled it.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Virginia (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, wit for weeks till hr contacts you, schedule a meeting with hiring managers, typical interview, then wait till they tell you they have chosen someone else.
Interview Questions: Why are you best suited?
